  • ARC Cache Example

ARC Cache Example¶

Overview¶

This example is designed to test the cache module of DesignWare® ARC® processors. Besides, it shows how to use ARC cache API defined in embARC BSP.

Detailed Description¶

  • Extra Required Tools

    NO

  • Extra Required Peripherals

    NO

  • Design Concept

    This example is designed to test the cache module of DesignWare® ARC® processors. Besides, it shows how to use ARC Cache API defined in arc_cache.h.

Note

Hardware support: Only works for DesignWare® ARC® processors that contain cache, please check your DesignWare® ARC® processors configuration before running this example

Building and Running¶

Taking EM Starter Kit as exmaple, the commands to run this example are as follows:

$ cd <embarc_root>/example/baremetal/arc_feature/cache
$ make BOARD=emsk BD_VER=22 CUR_CORE=arcem7d TOOLCHAIN=gnu run

Note

Make sure you have selected the correct configuration of EM Starter Kit via dip switches and that you have reset the board (button above “R”).

embARC Build Time: Mar 26 2018, 17:07:17
Compiler Version: Metaware, 4.2.1 Compatible Clang 4.0.1 (branches/release_40)
Data cache, ver:4, capacity:16384, ways:2, line len:32
Instruction cache, ver:4, capacity:16384, ways:2, line len:32
fill the data cache with data
cache data:0,  mem data:0
lock the data in data cache
invalidate data cache, even it's locked
cache data:3c3c3c3c,  mem data:3c3c3c3c
invalidate one cache line
cache the data into one cache line with 0xff
cache data:ffffffff,  mem data:0
flush the changed cache line
cache data:ffffffff,  mem data:0
cached the data into one cache line again with 0x55
cache data:55555555,  mem data:0
lock the changed cache line
flush the whole data chache, the locked line won't be flushed
cache data:55555555,  mem data:0
refill the cache with data
cache data:3020100,  mem data:3c3c3c3c
flush multiple cache lines
cache data:3020100,  mem data:3c3c3c3c
